subject: p19182863
Findings: The patient is status post sternotomy and both mitral and aortic valve replacements. Moderate cardiomegaly is unchanged. The mediastinal and hilar contours appear stable. There is new mild-to-moderate relative elevation of the right hemidiaphragm which suggests volume loss and a patchy opacity in the right lower lobe has increased and is worrisome for pneumonic consolidation. There is probably also some degree of new opacification in the right middle lobe. A vague opacity is also new in the right suprahilar region in the right upper lobe, potentially an early focus of pneumonia. There is no definite pleural effusion.
Impression: Findings suggest multifocal pneumonia involving the right lung.
